title: Certificate Type ID please
content:
A little [Galba](http://web.archive.org/web/20131106074252/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itfmecanorma/galba/), but not quite -- Galba comes without lower case letters, and it's not that narrow ... could somebody help to ID this font? Thanks a lot!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131106074252im_/http:/typophile.com/files/TypeID_6703.jpg)
author: tina

comments.content:
The top sample is a squooshed [Trajan,](http://web.archive.org/web/20131106074252/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=trajan&x=0&y=0&sample_text=ANTIQUAIRES) the bottom is a squooshed [Palatino.](http://web.archive.org/)

- Lex
I was hesitant because of the r - but yes, squooshing makes this possible, indeed ;-) - Thank you!
